pr_title: Remember last selected media type for downloads.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    String defaultMedia = prefs.getString(getString(R.string.last_used_download_type),
          
          
            
                    final String defaultMedia = prefs.getString(getString(R.string.last_used_download_type),
timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
String defaultMedia = prefs.getString(getString(R.string.last_used_download_type),
final String defaultMedia = prefs.getString(getString(R.string.last_used_download_type),
timeline.author: TobiGr

timeline.body: `(defaultMedia.equals(getString(R.string.video))` this will fail to detect the last used type when the user changed tha pplication language. Please create three keys in settings_keys.xml to avoid that.
timeline.bodyText: (defaultMedia.equals(getString(R.string.video)) this will fail to detect the last used type when the user changed tha pplication language. Please create three keys in settings_keys.xml to avoid that.
timeline.bodyHTML: (defaultMedia.equals(getString(R.string.video)) this will fail to detect the last used type when the user changed tha pplication language. Please create three keys in settings_keys.xml to avoid that.
timeline.author: TobiGr

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
SharedPreferences.Editor editor = prefs.edit();
final SharedPreferences.Editor editor = prefs.edit();
timeline.author: TobiGr

timeline.body: According to the [docs](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/content/Context#getString(int)), `getString(resInt)` cannot be `null`, thus defaultMedia cannot be `null` (as long as we don't put anything stupid into the preferences, which we clearly do not). I think, the assertion can be removed.
timeline.bodyText: According to the docs, getString(resInt) cannot be null, thus defaultMedia cannot be null (as long as we don't put anything stupid into the preferences, which we clearly do not). I think, the assertion can be removed.
timeline.bodyHTML: According to the docs, getString(resInt) cannot be null, thus defaultMedia cannot be null (as long as we don't put anything stupid into the preferences, which we clearly do not). I think, the assertion can be removed.
timeline.author: TobiGr
